title: In Syria's Aleppo, despite the fall of Bashar al-Assad, residents fear that 'poison' of division will persist
summary: While many people welcome the departure of the tyrant, this does not erase the years of violence during which the regime strove to pit one community against another.

title: French PM Bayrou appoints new government. Former prime minister Elisabeth Borne named education minister
summary: François Bayrou, the head of the centrist MoDem group, which is allied to Macron's party, was appointed on December 13.

title: Since the Olympics, everyone wants a piece of Léon Marchand − Mick Jagger included
summary: As the year draws to an close, sports journalist Elisabeth Pineau recalls the 'Marchand-mania' of the Paris Olympics.

title: Germany far-right party AfD holds march after Christmas market attack
summary: Anti-extremist initiative "Don't Give Hate a Chance" was also gathering nearby in Magdeburg, the site of Friday's carnage.

title: Pelicot rape trial: Read how the judges justified their verdict
summary: The court's judges explained their decisions in a 106-page document. Here are highlights.

title: The Christmas tree debate: 'If I take it away, I might as well call the whole thing off...'
summary: To tree or not to tree? Between lovers of tradition and opponents of the trend of consuming and throwing away, a war has been declared.

title: UN peacekeepers and Lebanon PM call for accelerated Israeli withdrawal from country
summary: Lebanese caretaker Prime Minister Najib Mikati also said the US and France should put pressure on Israel to complete its withdrawal faster, nearly a month into a fragile ceasefire between Israel and Hezbollah.

title: Matt Gaetz, Trump ally and former US lawmaker, paid for underage sex and used illegal drugs, says probe
summary: Gaetz, who was Trump's first pick to run the Justice Department, paid for sex numerous times and regularly used illegal drugs, according to a congressional report released on Monday.

title: Alleged killer of US insurance CEO pleads not guilty to 'terrorist' murder
summary: Luigi Mangione pleaded not guilty to murder and terror charges in a state case that will run parallel to his federal prosecution.

title: German Christmas market attack: Questions about authorities' failings put government under pressure
summary: The alleged perpetrator of the attack that left five people dead on Friday had been the subject of an alert issued by Saudi Arabia in November 2023, and an investigation was opened, concluding that there was no 'concrete danger.'

title: Biden commutes  sentences of almost all federal death row inmates
summary: The US president has spared the lives of 37 of the 40 people convicted in killings, including the slayings of police and military officers, and those involved in deadly bank robberies or drug deals.

title: Netanyahu says he aims to 'dramatically change' region with new peace accords
summary: The Israeli premier told lawmakers on Monday that Israel's war in Gaza had offered opportunities to sign new peace accords with Arab nations and 'dramatically change the face of' the Middle East.

title: Marcel Ciolacu reappointed Romanian PM
summary: This nomination is seen as a tactical push to shut out far-right nationalists who made significant gains in the December 1 parliamentary elections.

title: Only 12 trucks delivered food, water in North Gaza since October, says aid group Oxfam
summary: Israel, which has tightly controlled aid entering the Hamas-ruled territory since the outbreak of the war, often blames what it says is the inability of relief organizations to handle and distribute large quantities of aid.

title: In this family, four generations have made a living from Christmas trees
summary: The Bonorons have worked their land since 1958. They discuss how their trade has evolved, from the introduction of mechanization in the 1990s to competition from artificial trees.

title: Miss France 2025: Does anyone care?
summary: On December 14, Angélique Angarni-Filopon, from the French Caribbean island of Martinique, was crowned the new Miss France, following a well-established ritual.

title: French government criticized for the slow and disorganized aid to Mayotte shantytowns
summary: Ten days after Cyclone Chido wreaked havoc in the Indian Ocean archipelago, aid is only just beginning to arrive in the most deprived areas, where the number of victims is still unknown.

title: US president-elect touts 'the Trump effect' at rally in Phoenix
summary: In Arizona on Sunday, Donald Trump took credit for Wall Street's good health. Above all, he promised to quickly implement his campaign promises to curb immigration and put an end to what he calls the 'transgender lunacy.'

title: Honda and Nissan: The planned merger's challenges
summary: Corporate heads of Honda and Nissan have announced negotiations to establish a holding company by August 2026 that will oversee both groups, with Mitsubishi Motors perhaps also joining discussions next month.

title: Design: Behold five creations somewhere between dreams and science fiction
summary: A UFO armchair, creature lamps, deceptive mirrors... These strangely shaped objects take us on a cosmic, and earthly, journey .

title: Western, Turkish and Arab diplomats flock to Damascus
summary: The former rebels who toppled Bashar al-Assad's regime are cautiously supported by Europeans and Americans, with Turkey lending its solid backing.

title: In Romania, Prime Minister Marcel Ciolacu is reappointed, but the political crisis persists
summary: The Social Democrat has been reappointed to head a government of pro-European orientation, despite a sharp decline in his party's performance in the recent general election.

title: '2024 will go down in history as an annus horribilis for French politics'
summary: With four different prime ministers in one year, no budget and a slew of unfinished bills, France appears to be without direction and reduced to immobility, writes Le Monde's political columnist Solenn de Royer.

title: Faced with Elon Musk, Europe's space industry is looking for a new model
summary: To reinforce its independence and resist SpaceX's offensive, Europe needs to build a new model by meeting industrial, technological and organizational challenges head-on.

title: UN condemns summary execution of over 200 people in Haiti this month
summary: The United Nations reports a brutal 'manhunt,' with victims taken from their homes in Port-au-Prince to be executed. The operation was ordered by a gang leader convinced that his son's illness had been caused by voodoo practitioners.

title: Not much is new about François Bayrou's government
summary: French Prime Minister François Bayrou has appointed experienced political figures, many of whom belong to the former governing coalition. This is as limited a base as that of his predecessor, and does not protect him from a motion of no confidence.

title: Family, associates and friends all claim the Pierre Cardin legacy
summary: Couturier Pierre Cardin, who died of Covid-19 on December 29, 2020, at the age of 98, left more behind than just a futuristic aesthetic. The fashion designer's empire, including the extraordinary Palais Bulles in the south of France, is at the heart of a war of succession pitting Rodrigo Basilicati-Cardin, the designer's great-nephew, against his many cousins.

title: French Far right rejoices after their political bête noire denied Ministry of Justice
summary: Ever since Xavier Bertrand's candidacy for the Ministry of Justice was first mooted, the Rassemblement National has voiced criticism of the man they consider to be one of their worst political enemies.

title: Russia sentences American man to 15 years in prison for 'espionage'
summary: On Tuesday, Moscow City Court sentenced the man, named as Gene Spector, to '15 years to be served in a strict-regime penal colony,' taking into account a sentence the defendant had already received for bribery, RIA Novosti state news agency reported.

title: 'Traitor' Manuel Valls to manage France's overseas territories in surprise political comeback
summary: The former Socialist turned Macron supporter, whose 'somewhat kamikaze personality' was hailed by PM François Bayrou, was chosen for his expertise on New Caledonia and, more broadly, for his experience in crisis management.

title: Syrians condemn presence of Israeli army and forced displacements in the Golan Heights
summary: Since the fall of Syrian dictator Bashar al-Assad on December 8, the Israeli army has moved into the buffer zone between the two countries, for the first time since 1974, when a disengagement deal was signed.

title: Gaza's 500 Christians celebrate second Christmas under bombs
summary: On Sunday, the Holy Family Church received a visit from the Latin Patriarch of Jerusalem, who tried to bring a little hope to the faithful who, like all Gazans, are fighting for survival amid Israeli strikes and food shortages.

title: American Airlines resumes flights after Christmas Eve ground stop due to 'technical issue'
summary: A technical issue forced the world's largest carrier to ground all its US flights for an hour on Tuesday, officials said. Flights have now resumed.

title: François Bayrou's failed gamble
summary: In forming his government, France's new prime minister has not succeeded in shifting the lines of the political division resulting from the June parliamentary elections, and finds himself in as uncomfortable a situation as his predecessor, Michel Barnier.

title: Syrian authorities say rebel groups have agreed to disband
summary: The country's new authorities announced on Tuesday that they reached an agreement with Syria's rebel groups on their dissolution and integration into the regular defense forces.

title: At Paris's Mamiche bakery, Cécile Khayat and Victoria Effantin bake with a joyful touch
summary: Since 2017, the dynamic, talent-packed duo has been baking breads, pastries and sandwiches in the heart of Paris. The key to their success? 100% homemade products sold in a cheerful, welcoming atmosphere.

title: Bashar al-Assad, Putin's refugee
summary: Since the fall of his regime, the Syrian dictator has joined family and relatives who were already in Russia. For years, the Assad clan has been transferring and investing a large amount of money in Moscow.

title: Twenty not-to-be-missed shows in Paris and beyond this December
summary: Theater, opera, dance, comedy, circus, storytelling, puppetry: Le Monde's critics have selected the performances to book for the end of the year.

title: The fifteen best Yule logs of 2024
summary: All vanilla or intensely chocolatey, meringue or ice cream, praline or fruit? Here are our favorite versions of this must-have dessert for end-of-year meals.

title: Design: Four must-see exhibitions in Paris as the year ends
summary: In December, come and explore five Parisian galleries to discover Ron Arad's homage to Jean Prouvé, the work of post-war French designers and exquisite Japanese wickerwork.

title: At the Moulin Rouge, champagne never stops flowing
summary: Some 250,000 bottles of champagne are consumed every year at the Pigalle cabaret, where 50 waiters serve 900 guests every evening in a ballet that swirls and sparkles just like the stage shows.

title: From a Paris suburb to NASA: How young aerospace engineer Allan Petre shot for the stars
summary: Petre joined the US space agency in January 2023. From a modest background, he followed his passion – space – and set his sights very high – NASA – while refusing to back down.

title: On Christmas Eve, Pope Francis launches holy Jubilee year
summary: The ceremony was attended by cardinals and Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni among others, while thousands of people gathered outside in Rome's St. Peter's Square watching on big screens.

title: Nearly two dozen killed in 24 hours in Mozambique after disputed election result
summary: '236 acts of serious violence' were reported across the country, leaving at least 25 people wounded, including 13 police officers, Interior Minister Pascoal Ronda said Tuesday. More than 100 people have already died in the unprecedented post-election violence after Venâncio Mondlane's claim of victory against winner Daniel Chapo.
